definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: The most deeply convinced art in people's heart should be such a humane art.
sentences.chinese: 人类内心深处最服膺的，应是这种符合人性的艺术。

sentences.english: We were acknowledging our consumers' power in the marketplace and openly bowing to their demand.
sentences.chinese: 我们确认市场上消费者的力量并服膺他们消费需求。

sentences.english: In the meantime, please be assured of our most cordial good wishes and of our desire to be of service.
sentences.chinese: 同时，请服膺我们最真挚的希望和为您效力的热看。

sentences.english: The more love life, more can't remember life conditions.
sentences.chinese: 了，越爱人生，就越不能服膺生活者的条件。

definition: to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
to persist/to continue upholding/to persevere/to stick to sth/stubborn
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
work or plans left as a legacy/the views of the departed/posthumous orders or teachings
